intro: Rhexia caudata, commonly known as the pinkroot, is a herbaceous perennial native to the southeastern United States. It belongs to the Montiaceae family and is characterized by its low-growing habit and clusters of pink to magenta flowers. The plant typically thrives in moist, acidic soils and is often found in wetlands, swamp edges, and along stream banks. Its leaves are lance-shaped and often have a reddish tinge, while its roots are tuberous and can be pinkish in color. Rhexia caudata plays an important ecological role by providing nectar for pollinators and stabilizing soil in wetland environments.
